requirements.summary: Build a responsive public marketing site with clear navigation and sections for Home, About, Programs, Schedule, Instructors, Pricing, FAQ, and Contact.
acceptanceCriteria: Site has a header navigation that links to each page/section (desktop and mobile).
All pages/sections render well on mobile, tablet, and desktop.
Each page/section contains sensible placeholder English copy that can be replaced later (no lorem ipsum).

file_operations.description: Create the main marketing layout with a responsive header navigation and on-page sections (Home hero + highlights, About, Programs/Classes, Schedule, Instructors, Pricing/Memberships, FAQ, Contact).
Add a responsive header with desktop links and a mobile menu that anchors to each required section.
Add a footer with secondary navigation and academy contact/branding placeholders.
Implement the Home hero + highlights section with strong placeholder copy and CTAs that jump to Programs/Pricing/Contact.
Implement the About the Academy section with replaceable English copy (mission, values, training philosophy).
Implement Programs/Classes section (kids, teens, adults, family, competition team) using reusable section/card layouts.
Implement Schedule section with a responsive weekly grid/table and notes (trial class, arrivals, uniform).
Implement Instructors section with instructor cards (name, rank, specialties, short bios) using placeholder copy.
Implement Pricing/Memberships section with tier cards and a clear disclaimer that pricing is placeholder and can be updated later.
Implement FAQ section (uniforms, belts, trial, age minimums, cancellations) with accessible expandable items.
Implement Contact section container that includes the contact form (wired in REQ-2) and static contact details placeholders.
Ensure the app renders the new App component and that global providers remain intact for responsive site behavior.

requirements.summary: Implement a Contact form that validates inputs and submits inquiries to the backend, showing loading/error/success states.
acceptanceCriteria: Contact form validates required fields (name, email, message) and shows inline errors.
On successful submission, the user sees a confirmation state and the form resets.
Backend stores inquiries in stable storage and returns them via an API method.
Frontend submits inquiries to the backend and handles loading/error states.

file_operations.description: Create the contact form UI (name, email, phone optional, message) with inline validation, loading state, error state, and a success/confirmation state that resets the form after submission.
Add a hook that uses useActor to call the backend capability submitContactForm, exposing loading/error/success helpers for the ContactForm.
Wire the ContactForm into the Contact section and ensure the section remains responsive on mobile/tablet/desktop.

requirements.summary: Add an admin-only inquiries view protected by Internet Identity login and admin authorization checks.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin view requires Internet Identity login; unauthenticated users cannot access the inquiry list.
Only the canister-defined admin principal(s) can view inquiries; non-admin authenticated users are denied.
Admin view displays inquiry fields and submission timestamp, and supports basic empty/loading/error states.

file_operations.description: Create an admin-only page that lists contact submissions (most recent first) and renders empty/loading/error states. Use the authorization component guidance for Internet Identity authentication + access control. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a guard component that (1) requires Internet Identity login before showing protected content and (2) checks admin status via backend capability isCallerAdmin, showing an access-denied UI when unauthorized. Use the authorization component to support this flow. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a login/logout button using Internet Identity from the existing authentication hook patterns. Use the authorization component guidance for login/logout and clearing cached data on logout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a hook that loads inquiries via backend capability getAllSubmissions and provides loading/error/empty handling for the admin UI.

Wire the AdminInquiries view into the app navigation/routing (e.g., a dedicated route or hash path) and ensure it is wrapped in RequireAdmin so unauthenticated and non-admin users cannot access the list.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent martial-arts academy visual theme using Tailwind (non-blue/purple primary palette) and existing UI components without modifying immutable sources.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistently applied to navigation, buttons, cards/sections, and typography.
Color palette avoids blue/purple as the primary theme colors.
UI uses Tailwind styling and existing UI components without modifying immutable component sources.

file_operations.description: Add global Tailwind styles and CSS variables for a distinct martial-arts theme (e.g., black/near-black, warm neutral, red and/or gold accents) avoiding blue/purple as primary; include base typography and spacing defaults.
Adjust theme extensions (if needed) to support the new brand palette, typography, and consistent section spacing tokens while keeping Tailwind conventions.
Apply the theme consistently across layout, navigation, section headers, buttons, and cards by composing existing UI components (do not edit immutable UI component sources).

requirements.summary: Add the required generated images as static assets and use them in the hero and branding areas (no backend image serving).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are present under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames.
Home page uses the hero image in the top section.
Brand mark/logo image is used in the header and footer (or equivalent branding area).

file_operations.description: Add the generated Taekwondo academy logo mark image at frontend/public/assets/generated/tkd-logo.dim_512x512.png.
Add the generated wide hero banner image at frontend/public/assets/generated/tkd-hero-banner.dim_1920x800.png.
Add the generated subtle repeating background pattern at frontend/public/assets/generated/tkd-pattern.dim_1024x1024.png.
Use the static logo image from frontend/public/assets/generated/tkd-logo.dim_512x512.png in the header branding area.
Use the static logo image from frontend/public/assets/generated/tkd-logo.dim_512x512.png in the footer branding area.

Use the static hero image from frontend/public/assets/generated/tkd-hero-banner.dim_1920x800.png in the top hero section and apply the background pattern from frontend/public/assets/generated/tkd-pattern.dim_1024x1024.png in a subtle, readable way.
